greetingSubtitle: Functional programming, accessibility, powerful library for image visual effects — you will find those topics in today's issue of SetTimeout. Have a fun!

cards.title: Optimising Largest Contentful Paint
cards.description: The author wants to show you some interesting tricks and optimisations, as well as some pitfalls and bugs, starting with some very simple tips.
cards.author: Harry Roberts

cards.title: Intro to Website Accessibility with CSS
cards.description: This article covered a few of the main ways to make your site more accessible with CSS.
cards.author: Aden Eilers

cards.title: A Guide To Hover And Pointer Media Queries
cards.description: The author will talk about how to adapt our sites to the different scenarios of a device pointer: whether it has a pointer or not or how accurate it is.
cards.author: Cristian Díaz

cards.title: Forever Functional - From methods to functions, and back
cards.description: If you like functional style, it will be interesting for you to know how to transform array methods to functions and use them not only with arrays.
cards.author: Federico Kereki

cards.title: Why Go: The benefits of Golang
cards.description: For those who want to look beyond JavaScript and manage another language — think about Golang. Author tells about this instrument and it’s features.
cards.author: Julien Etienne

cards.title: JavaScript Function Composition: What’s the Big Deal?
cards.description: Yet another article for functional paradigm lovers. Read about functional composition and use it in your projects.
cards.author: James Sinclair

cards.title: Build indoor maps with Fabric.js and React
cards.description: Fabric.js allows you to drag, scale, and rotate images. What else this powerful library can do? Read in the article.
cards.author: Martin Kimani

cards.title: React Folder Structure in 5 Steps
cards.description: Perhaps one of the highly opinionated topics. This is just one way to structure the project. It suits you or not, you decide.
cards.author: Robin Wieruch

cards.title: Powerful Vue.js form development with FormKit
cards.description: Validation, styling, and localization forms in Vue. js using Form Kit. FormKit presents itself as a full-fledged framework created to help developers write great forms.
cards.author: Dylan Tientcheu
